org.openmuc.jdlms.client.hdlc
Class HdlcAddress

java.lang.Object
  org.openmuc.jdlms.client.hdlc.HdlcAddress

public class HdlcAddress
extends java.lang.Object

Represents an immutable HdlcAddress consisting of an upper address (logical device) and a lower address (physical device). The size of an HdlcAddress can be either 1, 2 or 4 bytes. Note that for client addresses, only 1 Byte long HdlcAddresses are allowed

Constructor Detail

HdlcAddress

public HdlcAddress()
Creates an HdlcAddress of 1 byte with logical address 0 (NO_STATION address)

HdlcAddress

public HdlcAddress(int upperAddress)
Creates an HdlcAddress of 1 byte. An HDLC client may only have an address of 1 byte

Parameters:
upperAddress - Logical address

HdlcAddress

public HdlcAddress(int upperAddress,
                   int lowerAddress,
                   int length)
Creates an HdlcAddress of defined length. Beware, that any length other than 1, 2 and 4 will throw an Exception on invoking encode() on that object

Parameters:
upperAddress - Upper part of the address (Logical Device)
lowerAddress - Lower part of the address (Physical Device)
length - Length of the HdlcAddress in bytes

isValidAddress

public boolean isValidAddress()
Checks if the HdlcAddress object represents a valid HDLC address according to IEC 62056-46 6.4.2.2 If this method returns false, encode() will throw an IllegalArgumentException

Returns:
true if the HDLC address is valid
